articles.title: Latest Russia-Ukraine war news: Live updates - The Washington Post
articles.description: More than 5 million refugees have now fled Ukraine, the U.N. says. Charles Michel, president of the European Council, arrived in Kyiv.
articles.content:
Ukrainian officials said Wednesday they would try to evacuate people from Mariupol, where encircled fighters are making a last stand after Russian forces advanced on the devastated port city.

articles.title: Boris Johnson tries to lure India toward the West - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Uncertainty about India’s position on the war in Ukraine will overshadow the UK prime minister’s trip.
articles.content:
LONDON  Britain and its closest security allies want to wean India off Russian weapons. But Boris Johnson will find New Delhi's relationship with Moscow difficult to unravel.

articles.title: Puzzling outbreak of liver disease in kids spreads outside Britain - 9News
articles.description: Health officials say they have detected more cases of a mysterious liver disease in children that was first identified in Britain, with new infections spreading to Europe and the US.

articles.author: Luke Hurst
articles.title: Mysterious spike in hepatitis in children sees cases around Europe - Euronews
articles.description: Last week, health authorities warned countries to be on the alert following a spike in cases of hepatitis of unknown origin in children in the UK.
articles.content:
Cases of acute hepatitis have been reported in countries around Europe, following a mysterious spike in cases of severe liver disease in children in the UK.
